segments.text: It's kind of sad how the woman is so focused on that one plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's missing all the chaos right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The overflowing sink is creating such a wasteful mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water just pouring out, and no one to stop it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy looks so determined reaching for the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that stool is unsteady; he might get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl waiting there, hopeful for a cookie, tugs at my heart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their little adventure could end in tears.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is calm, like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel sorry for the family if this leads to an accident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All that domestic peace disrupted by simple oversights.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The apron and dress make her seem so everyday, yet vulnerable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a poignant scene of innocence and neglect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Wish I could warn them before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
